title: Erigon didn't sync latest block but metrics and logs told me it did
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `thorax/erigon:v2022.02.01`

OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour

I used `web3py` to get the latest block number by invoking `w3.eth.get_block_number()` but erigon returned a old block and it seemed the chain was not synced successfully.

```python
In [72]: w3.eth.get_block_number()
Out[72]: 2599192
```
but it should be the latest one (from another GETH node)
```python
In [11]: w3 = Web3(Web3.HTTPProvider('https://cloudflare-eth.com/')); w3.eth.get_block_number()
Out[11]: 14158240
```

But in the metrics I saw erigon did sync the latest block
```
sync{stage="execution"} 14158235
sync{stage="finish"} 14158235
sync{stage="headers"} 14158162
```

and here is the latest logs from erigon container if it may help.
```
erigon       | [INFO] [02-07|09:57:39.258] [txpool] stat                            block=14158245 pending=230 baseFee=30000 queued=20755 alloc_mb=490 sys_mb=718

```

`erigon` parameters for container: `erigon --metrics --metrics.addr=0.0.0.0 --metrics.port=6060 --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090 --pprof --pprof.addr=0.0.0.0 --pprof.port=6061`

`rpcdaemon` parameters for contrainer: `rpcdaemon --datadir=/home/erigon/.local/share/erigon --private.api.addr=erigon:9090 --txpool.api.addr=erigon:9090 --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts=* --http.corsdomain=* --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,debug,net,trace,txpool --ws`

Our Database is ACID (until db commit - nobody can see any change in db). But metrics are not - each metric is independent and not related to db. 

Means - it’s ok that metrics are ahead of API

likely your node just was not in sync yet. 

What do you see in metrics now?

@AskAlexSharov

Then looks like sync{stage="headers"} is broken - never updating.
@AskAlexSharov Do you know what caused it and how can I fix it? since syncing took too much time, I really don't want to delete the DB and resync again :-(
I don’t think you need delete db because of broken prometheus metric.

@AskAlexSharov 
```
/ $ integration print_stages /home/erigon/.local/share/erigon/
Note: prune_at doesn't mean 'all data before were deleted' - it just mean stage.Prune function were run to this block. Because 1 stage may prune multiple data types to different prune distance.

```
I tried use another version of erigon, restarted `rpcdaemon` but still didn't work. :(
We know the reason, will fix soon

@AskAlexSharov  
Much thanks for all of you !

Hi, I tried the latest version `v2022.02.02`, I still can't get the latest block through rpc.
